metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32557 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that the process_report() function indata/whoopsie-upload-all allowed arbitrary file writes via symlinks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24').
